meanings.definition: Having a sharp or pointed top
meanings.sent1: The peaked mountain stood tall against the sky.
meanings.sent2: The roof of the house had a peaked shape.
meanings.sent3: The peaked hat made him look like a wizard.
meanings.sent4: The peaked tower reached towards the clouds.
meanings.sent5: The peaked trees formed a beautiful silhouette at sunset.

meanings.sent1: The excitement peaked when the winner was announced.
meanings.sent2: Her career peaked when she won the championship.
meanings.sent3: The music peaked at the chorus, making everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: His interest in the topic peaked after the fascinating lecture.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room peaked during the final moments of the game.

meanings.sent1: After days of no sleep, he peaked and had to rest.
meanings.sent2: Her health peaked after she caught the flu.
meanings.sent3: The excitement of the party made her feel peaked the next day.
meanings.sent4: The stress of the project caused him to peak and take a break.
meanings.sent5: The illness peaked, leaving her feeling exhausted and achy.
